sentence.Network_en: It is a part of Britain as yet largely unaccustomed to tourists.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国的这一块地方还很不为游客所熟悉。

sentence.Network_en: He began to comfort me with such unaccustomed gentleness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他开始以那种少有的温柔安慰我。

sentence.Network_en: Her feet hurt and her hands were rubbed raw from unaccustomed work.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种活儿她根本做不习惯，双脚疼痛，双手也蹭破了皮。

list.abs: He was not unaccustomed to command ., 发号施令在他并非不习惯.
the unaccustomed luxury of cheap foreign travel ., 廉价国外旅游中难得的享受.

is still unaccustomed to a life of stress ., 仍然无法适应充满压力的生活.

entry.tran: 不习惯的；不熟悉的；不适应的
entry.def: If you are unaccustomed to something, you do not know it very well or have not experienced it very often.

example.ex: They were unaccustomed to such military setbacks...
example.tran: 他们还不习惯这样的军事挫败。

example.ex: It is a part of Britain as yet largely unaccustomed to tourists.
example.tran: 英国的这一块地方还很不为游客所熟悉。

entry.def: If you describe someone's behaviour or experiences as unaccustomed, you mean that they do not usually behave like this or have experiences of this kind.

example.ex: He began to comfort me with such unaccustomed gentleness...
example.tran: 他开始以那种少有的温柔安慰我。

example.ex: His nose had been reddened by unaccustomed exposure to the California sun.
example.tran: 经过加州阳光不同寻常的照射，他的鼻子晒红了。

auth_sentence.content: The unaccustomed sound of the old piano startled me.
auth_sentence.res_content: The unaccustomed sound of the old piano startled me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The unaccustomed sound of the old piano startled me.

auth_sentence.content: Maybe Turkey has new relationships to which people are unaccustomed.

auth_sentence.content: Only in myth and fantasy do animals abruptly morph into unaccustomed shapes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Only in myth and fantasy do animals abruptly morph into unaccustomed shapes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Only in myth and fantasy do animals abruptly morph into unaccustomed shapes.

sentences.en: She is unaccustomed to public speaking.

sentences.cn: 他的不寻常的愤怒表情
